headline: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: This bacon carbonara recipe is a classic Italian dish that cooks in 20 minutes with spaghetti and bacon in a rich, creamy Parmesan and egg sauce.

video.name: How to Make Spaghetti Carbonara with Pancetta

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided, or as needed
salt and black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain, toss spaghetti with 1 tablespoon olive oil, and set aside.
Place diced bacon in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon on paper towels, reserving 2 tablespoons bacon fat in the skillet.

Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to bacon fat in the skillet. Add chopped onion and cook over medium heat until onion is translucent. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add wine and cook 1 minute more.

Return cooked bacon to the skillet; add cooked spaghetti. Toss to coat and heat through, adding more olive oil if it seems dry or sticks together. Add beaten eggs and cook, tossing constantly with tongs or a large fork, until eggs are barely set. Quickly add 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese and toss again. Season with salt and pepper (remember that bacon and Parmesan are very salty).
Serve warm with chopped parsley sprinkled on top and extra Parmesan cheese at the table.

review.reviewBody: This is my third time making this in three weeks. It is delicious! Sausage seems to always be on sale, and with prices the way they are, I found sausage to substitute perfectly for bacon in this recipe! Cook the sausage in the oven, slice it up, and follow the rest of the directions. It is hearty, delicious, and budget friendly. Tonight, I am adding in mixed vegetables. YUM!
As is, very good.
Absolutely amazing! My kids loved it too!
Delicious!
Loved it and even tried some apple cider vinegar when I was out of wine it worked just fine !!Loved the way you make the recipes so clear and easy to make!
Easy and Delicious

Made this for dinner and the whole family loved it! It will be a regular staple in our household from now on it. The only thing I did differently was to add a little more olive oil than what it called for as the last time I made spaghetti carbonara (a different recipe) it had come out a little dry. Also kept back a 1/4 cup of the pasta water to pour over it after all the ingredients were mixed in, as well.
This recipe was a hit! I followed the instructions to the tee and was very happy with the results. I’ll definitely make it again.
My family loved it. Only thing I’ll do different next time is add some cream to make it less dry.
Family loves it !!!

Absolutely delicious. Wouldn't change a thing. I did add a half cup of the reserved pasta water at the end, to help prevent the leftovers from drying out. Some folks have their own ideas as to how a true carbonera is supposed to be made, but this version is a winner with me.
If I was rating it on strictly being a Carbonara, which it isn't, it would have been * instead of ***.
Omitted wine and parsley added a dash of red pepper flakes, was a hit!
It was wonderful! My Italian husband loved it!
You should save about 1/2 cup of the pasta water and add it in at the end. Otherwise, fine.
I used 2 eggs and 2 egg yolks and added frozen peas. Yum
This was great! Recipe is right on, only modifications were that I added extra garlic as personal preference, and no parsley because the store was out!
The crisp bacon flavour is a treat. The relatively simple recipe is a regular hit with my family yet just sophisticated enough for serving to guests.

Here's my way... don't use bacon, use pancetta . Also, when using the eggs, you can use the whole egg, but I find separating the three egg yolks works better. Don't forget to use some of that pasta water (a mug full).
onions and wine not needed, why throw out bacon fat then use olive oil?

Eating this as I type and it's not the first time I've made it and it won't be the last. Done a lot of variations off this work horse and keep coming back to this as written version. Not using quality fresh grated cheeze and quality bacon is about the only way to really screw this up. My wife says it reminds her of our Italian adventures and that's good enough for me.

Directions were very simple and easy to follow. Having video link alongside it was extremely helpful as well. I added chopped arugula salad and some sliced mushrooms to enhance it. It ended up tasting delicious, merci beaucoup.

This was well received. However, my son gave it a "B" and my husband thought there was not enough of the "other stuff" (bacon, etc) in the dish. Another reviewer also mentioned to much spaghetti - curious as to what the ideal ratio is. Also, I don't think more olive oil is needed once the spaghetti is added and thoroughly mixed. But it must be mixed thoroughly. I added some additional oil when mixing it together and thought the final dish was a bit too oily for me. Overall a good recipe and I will make this again.

Easy and excellent! I added about 2 oz heavy cream to beaten eggs, more garlic, and left all of the bacon fat. I know that I added a lot of calories, but I rode 20 hard miles on my bike so I earned it!
Delicious, perfect for a large group. Loved the bacon.
It was a little dry, so I added extra olive oil and bacon grease. I also only used 6 slices of thick cut bacon, and added peas and chicken. I served it with garlic bread and salad
Seemed a bit dry to me but my 8 year old grandson gobbled it down and asked for seconds. Next time I will add a bit of cream to moisten it up. Overall this is definitely a keeper.

Great recipe! The only change was I did not have any parsley. Next time I think I may throw in some leftover veggies. Would also like to try it with the heavy cream, but one reviewer used 3/4 cup which I think would/could be a bit much. Wife loved it too!
No Changes It was Delicious

An excellent way to celebrate the end of the business day. The wife and I enjoyed putting the meal together. However, we prefer to use an abundant amount of black pepper. No matter how you wish to tweak it, it's a great meal easy to fix and clean up.
What a great recipe! I added tomatoes and spinach! So good!
The family loved this recipe, especially the 3 year old! I added fresh, quartered cherry tomatoes from the garden, to use them up. Their sweet zing was a lovely compliment to this recipe.
Nice and easy to make. Changed to half onion and only 2 eggs due to only feeding 2 people with left overs available.

I made this and it is AMAZING! I did use an unoaked Chardonnay. I cooked the bacon in whole pieces and diced them after they drained and cooled. I used linguine cuz I love linguine. Even when I make traditional spaghetti I use part thin spaghetti and part linguine. There’s so many other things you can do with it. I may add spinach next time!

I have Tyler Florence's recipe memorized but it does take a fine touch because you have to be careful to not scramble the eggs. (When you get it right though, it is heavenly.) So I'm always casting about for a more "fool-proof" recipe. This one was pretty close. One negative: I have learned to NEVER mix oil with just-drained pasta so I didn't do it here. Sauce will not adhere to oily pasta. Oh, yeah, one more thing - ALWAYS reserve some pasta water to manage the consistency of the sauce. You don't have to use it but you'll want it there in case you need it. All that cream and peas and other stuff just makes it a different recipe, not a classic carbonara. Overall, a pretty good recipe.
So easy and so good.
I used fettucini rather than spaghetti. I am not a fan of spaghetti but I really like spinach fettucini and it makes a fabulous carbonara
I add a quarter cup of cream cheese and asagio cheese for richer cheesy flavor
Excellent!
I liked this recipe so did the grouping made it for. It’s a huge amount of food. I made no changes to the recipe. Next time I will increase the garlic.
Delish! Wouldn't change a thing!
It’s easy, simple but yet delicious. I added tomatoes and green peas.
Everyone loved it. I used about 10 slices of smoked applewood bacon and a pound of fettuccini.
Not for my family. I made it as written but did add the whole package of bacon which was 12 oz. We found it very bland with too much pasta.
Great. No changes required. Thanks
Great taste, easy to prepare. I did use less pasta and added the cheese and a bit of Italian seasoning the the egg mixture. My husband loved it.
Use spaghetti squash instead of pasta.
Good recipe! I have made this for my husband several times. He's a picky eater. It's a great go to recipe when you don't have many groceries in the house.
My son's absolute favorite dish that I make. I buy the pancetta from the deli section vice bacon. I use slightly less egg mixture than called for in the recipe. Lovely dish!
Turned out great! I’ve lived in Italy for four years and this recipe does justice for the original style from Roma.

This is a very good recipe. I didn't really change anything except switched fried eggs for poached eggs. Everything else remained the same It's a perfect and super easy recipe. Didn't really remind me of breakfast but, who cares? Way to go!

Love this, but glad I made the adjustments several reviewers suggested: added a dash of cream & white wine, mushrooms, sundried tomatoes, peas. I used bacon cuz that's what I have (and love). It was borderline dry, so maybe need more cream

I believe the instructions for the egg/parmesan mixture are wrong. I am surprised so many people had success making the dish this way. The minute I added the eggs into the pan, I knew this was not right. I ended up with scrambled eggs, even on the lowest heat. I looked at other carbonara recipes and they said to mix the beaten eggs with the parmesan first, then add to pasta OFF the heat. Also, it suggests to add a little of the pasta cooking water to the the entire mixture in order to get the desired consistency. I think the eggs can also be reduced to just 2 and that would be enough for the sauce. The saving grace of this dish is the bacon. My son still loved the pasta, even though he thought the scrambled eggs were a little weird. I will make this again in the future but with modified cooking method.

I made this for the first time tonight. It was lacking something...don't know what. Maybe it would be better with thicker bacon. I would add salt to the boiling water just before adding the pasta. Even with all the bacon and cheese, it still needed a bit of salt.

Great recipe Sabrinatee! I have always wanted to try this so I finally made it today. My family and I loved it! I made it exactly as listed and I can’t think of an ingredient that I would add or replace. I’ll definitely be making this a lot more in the future. Thank you!

My husband made this a few months back and it was just okay ( 2 star rating), BUT then I tried it again and merely followed the advice of one of the reviewers who stated, "An Italian friend of mine who cooks told me that the proper way to make smooth Carbonara sauce is to combine the beaten eggs with the grated Parmesan, and then to pour that mixture onto the spaghetti once the spaghett has cooled slightly (so that it's still hot, but so the eggs don't cook (that was our problem last time making it dry and sticky) and the cheese melts seamlessly into the eggs and pasta)...". I followed this to a "T" and it was INCREDIBLY CREAMY!!! 5 STAR PLUS!!!!! Here is my husband's previous review (what you can expect when you don't allow the spaghetti to cool): This pasta is just a little bland and dry for my tastes, but I am largly ignorant of what Spaghetti Carbonara is supposed to taste like. That being said, our company loved the dish and said it reminded them of the food they ate while living in France which apparently tends to have a little less zing than American recipes. Maybe I'll try preparing it next time with some salmon mixed in rather than bacon.
Perfect, just added a cup of pasta water before adding in the eggs.

can use linguini. definitely use wine. adjust garlic to 3 cloves & bacon 1 overflowing c of chopped. almost a bag of parmesan or parm/regano. Add 1/2 t red chili flakes for a kick. add 2T milk and 3T pasta water to egg/cheese mixture bf adding to dish

I loved this. I double the Parmesan cheese and added an additional egg because I had read reviews about the noodle ratio being too much. And it was delicious, but it was the bacon/onion ratio to the noodles that isn’t enough. So I would do more bacon/onion or 1/4lb less of the noodles.
Tends to be alittle dry but add olive oil and it's all together. Family love it and was surprise by it.
Tends to be alittle dry but add olive oil and it's all together. Family love it and was surprise by it.

This is a family favorite and easy to make. I always add a little more wine and Parmesan cheese.(1/2 cup wine and 1 cup cheese). So delicious!!! I also, on occasion, add boneless skinless chicken breasts sliced and cooked separately with a little bacon grease and Italian seasonings for extra something when my husband wants more meat than just bacon. Definitely a crowd pleaser and a keeper!!!

Came out delicious. Used the pound of pasta. Had more bacon precooked so it was all in. Used filtered bacon fat that we save in the refrigerator. Came together fast. Used 1/4 Cup sauvignon blanc. Made it in a heavy high walled cast iron pan so when it was time to turn the eggs in with tongs it was on residual heat sitting on the stove. Transferred to large serving bowl that wasn't hot and at that point worked and the parm in so it struck to the hot food not the wall. Had to eat before the salad it was too good to wait!
It was edible, but I can’t say much more for it. Basically flavorless. Maybe if I added a lot more of everything...
I substituted turkey bacon. It was very good.

Perfect just the way it is ;) Wowza. My family gobbled this up so fast. All the tips were perfect. Thank you! We're on a virtual vacation in Italy right now and this was perfect for all the kids ages: 8, 10, 12. Double Yum!
I tried mixing the egg and parmesan together, as recommended in the comments and just wasn't very pleased with the result. I'd like a creamier sauce next time. Don't think I'll reuse this recipe.
This is by far the best carbonara recipe I’ve found...delicious...do not leave out the white wine, it’s an essential ingredient here.
Loved this recipe. Took the advice of mixing cheese with eggs before adding pasta. Delicious.
I followed some previous reviewers guidance to add the cheese to the egg mixture and then pour onto the dish. Worked out perfectly. Made no other changes and plan to make this again soon!
easy and good

This was delicious! Used gluten free casarecce noodles. Otherwise only other change was to use whole package of bacon (used thick cut so 12 slices in pkg) and added 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg. Not sure if it made a difference or not but, WOWZA! This dish was fantastic! My husband and kids were temporarily grossed out when I told them it was eggs over the pasta but they managed to keep shoveling into their moths til it was all gone.
This was fabulous! I did mix the Parmesan cheese and eggs and added them together to the spaghetti after it was coated with the oil/bacon grease mixture.
Easy and super delicious!

It was okay, however I probably won't make it again. We had to add a lot of extra oil then the recipe required to keep the pasta and onions from drying out. As well we needed way more Parmesan than the recipe required. It was good however could've used more bacon,or more spices, and it just seemed to be missing something overall.
Loved it! Was easy to make and fun too! I added cream instead of wine and a touch of nutmeg as suggested. Will make this a lot!

delicious and creamy! I made a few changes because of my families taste. I fried up 12 slices of bacon . I added 1/4 cup of parmesan mixed in with the eggs and I topped it with a generous sprinkle of crushed red pepper flakes. I will be making it again soon!

My husband doesn’t normally like spaghetti that much, or even pasta for that matter. But he rated this a 5 star +! He said it was the best spaghetti he’s ever eaten. I will definitely be adding this to our menu rotation!
Deliciousand easy
Made it for my family for dinner. They loved it! I did add a little left over boiled spaghetti water if it got dry waiting for the eggs to set.
Loved it! My husband said babe this is awesome please save recipe so you can make it again.
This meal was amazingly delicious. We could not stop eating it. Will definitely make again and again.
My family of four loved this. I would add more garlic and can think of several other things I could add/substitute. Definitely a keeper!
Yummy!! I mixed the eggs with the parm as other reviewers suggested and made sure that i added it in OFF the heat as to not scramble the eggs.

Loved this pasta. I have never used eggs in a pasta like this before. Hubby was a little skeptical when I told him what I was making but he also loved this dish. Super easy to prepare and a must make again.
Might substitute pancetta for bacon.
I thought this dish was to dry tasting and so did my husband. I think it need cream added to it.
Good but not sure it was worth all the calories.
Tasty, used left over bacon and it was yummy, trick is to not scramble the eggs.

Super yummy! I followed this recipe exactly as is, making only 1 minor change. I mixed the cheese and eggs together before adding to pasta. I will add more bacon next time I make this. This is definitely a keeper! Thank you for the amazingly creative yummy recipe!
Made this with Canadian Bacon and it was just right without being to salty. Thanks!

I made this following the directions as is. This was my first time making this dish and it was fast,easy and inexpensive My husband loved it so much he ate the WHOLE dish! thank you so much for sharing this recipe.
Great recipe! Perfect for beginners like me. My whole family loved it.

I've made this a few times....once for a huge church gathering and a couple times again for my family at home. It's a HUGE hit each time I make it. I'm about to make it again today.
I serve it with a salad and garlic bread. What a delicious meal it makes!
I used bucatini pasta instead of basic spaghetti. It was amazing. I will definitely make it again!
Delicious!! Next time I’ll substitute bacon for Canadian bacon
Excellent recipe. I didn't change a thing!

My first crack at Carbonara and it was a HUGE success. Wow! it was perfection and my husband was talking about it for days! I added more bacon, cause duh... its bacon! but other than that I followed exactly as written and it was so delicious! If you are craving a rich and decadent pasta that is really easy, try this recipe right now!
Instead of bacon equal amount of pancetta
